message_1: In a committee of 7 members, how many ways can we choose 3 members to form a subcommittee?
message_2:
To choose 3 members out of 7, we can use the combination formula, which is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of members (7 in this case), k is the number of members we want to choose (3 in this case), and ! denotes the factorial function.

So, we have:

C(7, 3) = 7! / (3!(7-3)!)

C(7, 3) = 7! / (3!4!)

C(7, 3) = (7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(4 × 3 × 2 × 1))

C(7, 3) = (7 × 6 × 5) / (3 × 2 × 1)

C(7, 3) = 210 / 6

C(7, 3) = 35

So, there are 35 ways to choose 3 members out of 7 to form a subcommittee.
